intro: Astragalus idoneus, commonly known as the Indian milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It plays a role in soil stabilization and provides forage for wildlife. Astragalus idoneus is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
